website_summaries.verdict: This lightweight bag is easy to use and pack, and it's warm enough for camping in spring or fall.
pros: Easy for one person to pack up
Zipper won't catch on the fabric when zipping it up
Can connect two sleeping bags together by the zippers
cons: This sleeping bag is too small to accommodate adults over 6 feet tall

customer_reviews.title: Used Once and Gone to the Donation Pile
customer_reviews.text: This is actually a good sleeping bag...except for the inside fabric, which others have complained about. Used these once, and they are going in the donation pile. I don't think you can even call the inside lining a fabric; it's more of a lining or interface "fabric". It is scratchy, it catches on every scab, toe nail, etc...does Not feel nice next to skin.
customer_reviews.author: James C. Hirschinger

customer_reviews.title: Not worth purchasing
customer_reviews.text: Don't purchase this sleeping bag. Save your money and purchase a better quality bag. Pros: Nice design/color Quality Zipper Decent Size Cons: The inside fabric liner of this sleeping bag is terrible. The fabric is rough and it's also used on the exterior of the sleeping bag (near the opening as a decorative liner). I used this camping over the weekend and unfortunately the area I was camping at had a lot of weed sticker burrs. The burrs would get stuck on my dogs, they would walk on the sleeping bag and it got stuck all over the liner fabric. I spent an hour each day trying to remove it from the fabric.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Overall this sleeping bag was great. We used it on a recent camping trip. I love how you can combine it with another o e to make a bigger sleeping bag. It kept my son comfortable and cozy throughout the night. The only complaint is more for sleeping bags in general....wish they went back into the bag they came in the same way. We ditched the bag and just keep it rolled up.
customer_reviews.author: A.Celi

customer_reviews.title: Snug as a bug
customer_reviews.text: Decent lightweight sleeping bag! Used in Yellowstone. Was a little colder than expected when we were there but this bag is warm to the temperature advertised! It got down to 20 on us a couple nights. Ended up wearing some warm clothes to bed with this. Definitely warm to 40 degrees. Below that you may need something a little heavier or be prepared to bundle a little! Great purchase though!
customer_reviews.author: Thrifty Buyer

customer_reviews.title: First camping trip a success!
customer_reviews.text: First camping trip for me. Ordered a crap ton of gear, including this sleeping bag. Hubs said to order a warmer one, but I get really hot when I sleep and this one was just perfect. The overnight temperature hovered between 42-45 degrees and I was snug as a bug in a....Enough of that now :) Suffice to say, I really like this bag and see more camping in our future.
customer_reviews.author: IvanaYvonne

customer_reviews.title: Good, all around sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this cause I needed one while chaperoning a youth camp trip for church. It performed like a sleeping bag should and even comes with directions on how to fold back up to put back in the storage sleeve. Used it during one of the hotter weeks of July, so it was mostly open the entire time. Though when the night got cool on a couple of nights it kept me warm. Would recommend and purchase again if I needed another in the future
customer_reviews.author: TheDude

customer_reviews.title: very warm
customer_reviews.text: The sleeping bags are ok, but feel very sweaty and humid. They are not suited for warm weather in my opinion. They will probably work better in Fall or early Spring. They are also somewhat bulky. Good price though. Having no hood makes the bags more uncomfortable as you either need a pillow and stick you head and shoulders out or end up covering your face...
customer_reviews.author: busy mom

customer_reviews.title: Sleepover and summer car camping bag
customer_reviews.text: Accurate listing and description. I bought three for a family trip up north. These are casual summer camp and sleepover bags. They stuffed back into the bags, which have a clever zipper gusset so the bag gets a bit larger so it is possible to stuff it back in without killing yourself. I haven’t washed and dried them yet. But they seem well made and just like the ones I remember from childhood., so I have no worries.
customer_reviews.author: PFJ

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've used it between the low 40's and mid 60's. If you don't have good socks it might not be warm enough below ~45 degrees. It's pretty standard, but the lining is comfortable. I am right at 6' and it is plenty long. I have washed it twice now and it has held up pretty well. The only bad thing is that a lump of batting has collected near my feet (not from washing, I seem to kick it together in my sleep). It feels kind of weird so I have tried to even it out. There aren't any places where batting is missing however, so I think this is just loose fragments.
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne

customer_reviews.title: It's definitely worth the price it is.
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for with this thing, the filler gets bunched up and becomes like rocks. It gets incredibly hot. This is so annoying in a hammock. I recommend anything but this. Zipper seems high quality but gets caught a lot and is just pretty crappy over all.
customer_reviews.author: Samaan

customer_reviews.title: Damaged
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited when I got home to find my smiling box waiting for me but when I opened it up I found that one of my sleeping bags bag (the bag that stores the sleeping bag) was damaged. The sleeping bag itself is fine but put a damper on my mood.. I can’t wait to use it this weekend. The inside of the sleeping bag is super soft and it is really light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Only so-so
customer_reviews.text: I'm a person who likes to wash cloth items before using them. The outer covering ripped the first time I washed it. Also, once I unzipped it completely, I had a devil of a time getting the zipper started again. The only reason I'm not giving it a lower score is that it was very inexpensive so I figure you can't expect a fabulous product. Still, I had historically come to expect better than this from the Coleman brand. :-(
customer_reviews.author: MJH

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag
customer_reviews.text: I liked this bag. It has a soft like micro fiber inside. The bag itself seems well suited to go down to 40. But I have only had it down tp 50 degrees. Even still it breathed very well. I did NOT wake up too hot or sweaty.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: HOLE- y moley
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old daughter wanted a blue sleeping bag for her birthday. I ordered this one and it came with holes in it- stitching had pulled apart about 4-6 inches in a couple places. Decent bag, but not if they come with holes and poorly stitched seams. This will not last long. Expected more from coleman name. Sad girl, especially because by the time we realized it had a hole, we were camping in fall, in the Sierras- didn’t think to inspect a new product. Frustrated too since the return date had come and gone.
customer_reviews.author: EGA

customer_reviews.title: Warm, comfortable, bulky
customer_reviews.text: It's good and warm and comfortable, however it's very bulky. I take it camping and it takes up a ton of space in my 65 liter backpack. The bag that it came in was very poor quality. It has this nice zip on it which should help it stay smallish, but it broke the very first time that I put it back in the bag. I was very disappointed about that. I'm going to have to buy a compression sack for it.
customer_reviews.author: carley

customer_reviews.title: Don't use the compression zipper....it won't fit!!
customer_reviews.text: BEFORE BUYING GO GET YOURSELF SOME COMPRESSION STRAPS!!!!! Don't bother with the dumb zipper compression system they've sewn to the stuff bag. I've spent years backpacking with Boy Scouts, done AT through hikes, and several long distance hikes. I spent 45 minutes trying to get this stupid thing rolled tight enough to zip up. I was literally drenched in sweat, cussing, and beet red in the face. Finally, I gave it one last tight roll....stuffed it in its bag...the zipper FINALLY fit together. I pulled the tab, and RIIIIIIIIPPPPPPP. The zipper stitching came loose from the compression bag. I took my scissors, cut the zioper off entirely, picked up my phone, and ordered compression straps. YOUR COMPRESSION ZIPPER SUCKS COLEMAN!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Scott D Wilhelm

customer_reviews.title: WORKS GREAT - GOOD QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: We just returned from several camp trips and this bag worked dandy for my hubby. He was trying to find a bag that would fit in our travel trailer where the kitchen table makes into a bed. This fit great. He was also trying to find a bag that would not be too hot or too cold. Papa Bear said this bag was perfect! Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: bigskygal

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sleeping bag/comforter
customer_reviews.text: I am disabled and don't go camping; however I use this wonderful sleeping bag as a comforter on my bed. Better than any comforter I've ever owned/used. I simply unzip it when it arrives...and voila! It's a comforter! If you need warmth on your bed covers, this is for you. It's light weight and doesn't overheat you. Perfect....
customer_reviews.author: Adele C.

customer_reviews.title: Very comfy bag
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable bag and great value for the price. I used to regularly buy a Coleman model called the "Poplar" and this is the same bag except maybe 6 inches shorter and cost me 1/2 as much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shredded after one washing.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this sleeping bag shredded after one washing. Washed it the same way we wash all our sleeping bags and have never had problems with the other ones. Unfortunately it's past its return date. Too bad.
customer_reviews.author: mfxr88

customer_reviews.title: Quality, simple, good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Pretty comfortable, the zipper quality is great, didn't catch on the sleeping bag at all. Nothing special, perfect for our quick little trip to the lake and an overnight stay. I will say - two of these stacked does not make for comfort if your sleeping on the ground. I would recommend a blow up sleeping pad or something to go underneath.
customer_reviews.author: Moriah

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.text: Nice comfortable sleeping bag. The push zipper feature worked well and the bag rolled up really well. The only thing I didn’t like is that I can’t roll it tight enough to use the zipper on the carry bag. I actually broke the zipper trying to zip it back up after using. The carry bag still works well it’s just not as compact as when I first opened it. All in all a great sleeping bag, just not a great carry bag.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Good beginner's sleeping Bag for cool weather
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my first camping trip and it was so big that it couldn't fit my sleeping bag compartment of my backpack. I found other people had more compact sleeping bags and did the same job. However, this was a lot more cheaper than. Other sleeping bags and did a great job. I slept well in 30-40 degrees weather. Highly recommended if you're trying out camping.
customer_reviews.author: G. Choy

customer_reviews.title: Really? 'New' condition? Not so sure.
customer_reviews.text: The bag itself is a 5 star. But I want to give this 1 star as I believe Amazon sent this in 'used' condition. There was no packaging, no tags to remove. Just the rolled up bag. I immediately unrolled it only to discover 2 big tears along the zipper edge. Other than the holes and lack of packaging, it seemed totally clean with no other indication of use. Having to leave for my camping trip the next day and no time to shop for a new bag, I sewed up the holes and washed it in the laundry machine. The sleeping bad bag is soft, warm and served it's purpose well.
customer_reviews.author: CraziKaty

customer_reviews.title: 4 years and still in great shape
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my kids. They have lasted 4 years and are still going. We have a few in diapers, some leak through incidents, so they have been abused in a top load washing machine and line dried with no adverse outcomes. I have been careful to always ensure they were 100% dry before storage!
customer_reviews.author: Jared Chmielecki

customer_reviews.title: it's ok, but i am 6'2" and this barely ...
customer_reviews.text: it's ok, but i am 6'2" and this barely reached my shoulders. it kept me warm but i wore sweatpants and a hoodie with an additional small blanket around my shoulders and head to keep warm.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Cheap - Comfortable - Good zipper on sleeping bag. Cons: - The cord and hook method for keeping it rolled tight doesn't work very good and I'm afraid it might rip out the stitching if pulled too tight. - The zipper to compress the stuff compression sack broke right away.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, not great.
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty standard sleeping bag except the exterior is less water resistant and more fragile than what i think of when i think of a standard sleeping bag. I wasnt wearing pants for a lot of the night and my legs were a bit cold (20-30 degrees outside), once i put on pants i was plenty warm so i think the 40-60 degree rating ia accurate. Also, as other have stated, the material on the inside will catch your hang nails or dry skin.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: So nice we bought it twice
customer_reviews.text: A few years ago we bought this sleeping bag for our daughter for tent camping (summers at the beach). She loved it and it worked great. Warm enough for our purposes without getting overly hot. We’ve washed it in our washer and it’s held up great these past 3 summers. This year we bought a second one for our son now that he’s in his own bed. Again it worked great! It’s Coleman, you really can’t go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: KitVonDTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: A great deal on sleeping bags.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why these are getting such bad reviews. We bought two of these for our camping trip to Tahoe and they were a lifesaver. Ended up being super hot during the day and freezing cold at night. These were perfect. We haven't washed ours yet - if you read the tag it says to only wash if HEAVILY soiled. We shook ours out, and hung on the line to freshen. Loved the bags were easy to get them back into .
customer_reviews.author: Jasey

customer_reviews.title: Size, warmth, unzippable
customer_reviews.text: Unzipped and used as blanket in camp trailer. Put one on bed between sheets and comforter and had the 2nd one at the ready but we didn't get cold so didn't need it. Temperature at night was 50 degrees. Easy to rezip and stuff back into bags for those who are tent camping, backpacking or have limited space. Plenty warm for most conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Kandy

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Slow delivery.
customer_reviews.text: Product: we ordered the sleeping bags because we didn't have a bed for a few days and wanted a cheap substitute. For that purpose these are great! We bought two and layered them up for more cushioning. I think they can double up as a couple sleeping bag too. Waiting to see how they hold up during hikes. Overall, I like them quite a bit. Delivery: I ordered then when I had an urgent need and they were delivered 3 days late which caused us a lot of inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: Pratyusha

customer_reviews.title: Threads undone after one use - INDOORS
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use for camping, but decided to test it out this weekend for the first time. I used indoors last night, and merely slept on top of it for the extra cushion, but this morning when I was rolling it up I noticed roughly a 12 inch spot where the thread is pulling/unravelled. I'm sure this will effect the integrity of the bag when I actually need it, and unfortunately since I've used it and discarded the packing order, I doubt I'll be able to return it replace the item. I'm definitely disappointed considering I played the extra money to get a Coleman sleeping bag instead of a cheaper brand.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Owens

customer_reviews.title: Great in Utah's climate
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 of these. One for my husband and one for my 9 year old son. Great in Utah (both North in Summer and South in Spring/Fall) for tent camping. My 9 year old's been using his over a year and we just bought one for my husband a month or so ago to replace his old worn out sleeping bag he had since childhood.
customer_reviews.author: JustMe

customer_reviews.title: Coleman Sleeping Bag
customer_reviews.text: You cannot go wrong with this bag, you will find cheaper options out there but they dont perform as well as this sleeping bag. I have bought several bags and used them at least 4 times and im still so happy with them. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Bike4Life

customer_reviews.title: Quality control isn’t what it needs to be
customer_reviews.text: Went camping this weekend for the first time using this sleeping bag. My mistake for not checking it before the trip. It came out of the bag with the zipper separated from the sleeping bag. Thankfully we had a cabin this time otherwise it wouldn’t have been good. I ordered two in this order, the second one which my daughter used seems to be ok.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Reinhold

customer_reviews.title: Nice Warm-Weather Car Camping Bag - Stuff sack worthless
customer_reviews.text: Hey, this is not a great backpacking sleeping bag, but it sure is comfortable for car camping. Bought two - this and the 20-40F one - for my wife. Now she has a warm weather and cold weather. They both zip together. Flip the right temperature one to the top and have a bed for two. Forgot how nice having a fleece lined sleeping felt. The no-snag zipper is a joke, wished they just used a normal zipper. The stuff sacks aren't even a joke because you'll never get the bag back into it - even with it fully expanded. Amazing that I spent more on a good stuff sack than I did on the sleeping bag!
customer_reviews.author: J. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and Rest Allowed
customer_reviews.text: Nice light weight and comfortable. This sleeping bag will last me a good time and adds to my ability to enjoy the outdoors. I hate trying to sleep and not being able to due to heat, sweat and tight sleeping bags. This bag meets my standards and I find that it allows a good bit of movement so I do not feel like I am in an enclosed space.
customer_reviews.author: D. A. Donahue

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t get it to zip
customer_reviews.text: Couldn’t get it to zip. It comes with some funky zipper that makes it very complicated to zip up once you unzip it entirely. But the comfort was good. It kept me warm and it’s very nice and light weight. I returned it because of the zipper however.
customer_reviews.author: anita doran

customer_reviews.title: luckily they were pretty inexpensive. Getting the bag into the stuff sack
customer_reviews.text: Bought 3 of these for the kids for Scout Camp. One didn’t make it three days and the seams were coming loose. Sent it back and it was replaced but worried they won’t last as long as I hoped. luckily they were pretty inexpensive. Getting the bag into the stuff sack, like others reported, will never go back to the same size to allow the zipper to be used. Tried several times to roll The sleeping bag as tight as possible put in the sack and use the bags zipper, but it is again near impossible.
customer_reviews.author: Rkallstr

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sleeping bag!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great sleeping bag. It is very soft on the inside with a flannel feel. Yes, dry skin and, I'm sure, hang nails will slightly catch on the fabric as other reviewers have noted. However, unless you are incredibly dry like a crocodile or walk around with hang nails all the time, it isn't even noticeable or a bother. I probably wouldn't have thought twice about it had I not read the reviews first. It is roomy enough to move around in and kept me warm on a three night camping trip with 45 degree nights.
customer_reviews.author: Smithereens

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Arrived so fast And I was able to use it for guests that night. It doesn't have an odor like many new ones can have. We just used it right away, and when done, rolled it up. It is warm, but very lightweight. A great sleeping bag for when an unexpected guest shows up!
customer_reviews.author: Beth Hill

customer_reviews.title: Not good quality liner
customer_reviews.text: This thing is cheap . I’m not a camper and bought this for sleepovers and I can tell you I’d be suprised if it last 3-4 times inside . The inside liner is like a paper towel . Should have realized with the price being low . Oh well . If you want something that you use a couple times then this will work .
customer_reviews.author: tank

customer_reviews.title: Very warm and soft!
customer_reviews.text: Very warm and soft and my son who is 10, loves it. Inside is very soft flannel type material. It’s perfect for him. He took it to summer camp and it was warm enough for him. The strap that holds the sleeping bag together is a bit tricky for him to put it back together. My husband usually has to do it or a friends parent if he’s sleeping over somewhere with it. Great sleeping bag overall though.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Steven

customer_reviews.title: The inside of this sleeping bag isn't very comfy. ...
customer_reviews.text: The inside of this sleeping bag isn't very comfy. It's kind of scratchy and if you have any rough skin, it snags on it. I needed it for a camping trip and didn't have time to get a new one so I just used this one. I turned it inside out to sleep so I had the smooth outside against my skin. Much more comfy that way.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny G

customer_reviews.title: Ripped after one use.
customer_reviews.text: Used it once this past weekend and it’s already ripped. We’re 4 days out of the return window. This is so disappointing from a company like Coleman. We have other Coleman products that are great but this one is terrible quality. Don’t buy this if you’re not using it soon after delivery within you’re return window.
customer_reviews.author: Jill C

customer_reviews.title: Camping Review
customer_reviews.text: Went camping with my friends and low-key perfer this over my bed. It's really comfortable and will keep you warm. I'm about 5 foot 10 inches and I can plop myself into this thing with a problem. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: LeCario Benashley

customer_reviews.title: Warm and comfortable. Great value
customer_reviews.text: Don't let the other reviews scare you. Wash with fabric softener as written on the tag, and the interior lining won't stick to you. I used this with a thin camp-pad on a few 30 degree nights, and I stayed warm and cozy. Great value sleeping bag
customer_reviews.author: Mike K.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cool weather & easy to store
customer_reviews.text: I bought two coleman sleeping bags and they kept us warm in 35 degree weather. The perk to having two was we could zip them together to create one large 2 person sleeping bag!! Putting them back in the storage bag when done using them was quite easy, and it only took 1 person about 2 minutes to do. I would highly recommend Coleman brand sleeping bags.
customer_reviews.author: Malissa L.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty comfortable bag overall
customer_reviews.text: Decent sleeping bag for the price. I'm not one to really camp or sleep outdoors, but I needed a bag for a last minute summer camping trip. This is very soft on the inside. I didn't have as much of a problem with it sticking to my feet or anything as other review mentioned. Pretty comfortable bag overall, light enough for the heat but still kept me warm when it cooled down.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Very nice quality.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality. We purchased 2 of these on sale and the price was wonderful! Compared with a couple we purchased at a local store, these are far superior. The zippers are very sturdy and don't get caught like they do on the "cheaper" ones (that we paid about the same amount for!). Hope that is helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Karen G.

customer_reviews.title: I'm 54 and been using Coleman equipment like my father did, since 5 years old I can remember.
customer_reviews.text: It's a Coleman product and didn't disappoint me. I felt confident in purchasing it. Everything I ever bought with there logo on it was a long lasting an useful camp product.
customer_reviews.author: Jr.

customer_reviews.title: It insulates well, .. but
customer_reviews.text: This bag does what it's supposed to do and insulates well. Unfortunately my body does not like the polyester material at all. The material just has an agitating effect on my nerves. I did keep the bag however and will use it for a back up blanket when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Did its job at camp!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 6th grade daughter who went to camp for a few days in a 45 degree at night zone. She reported she was kept warm and dry with this and fit inside it without issue. 5'4. She was even able to fold it back up in the bag, an added bonus, laugh. Recommended. (j4.)
customer_reviews.author: John IV

customer_reviews.title: Using it in the house
customer_reviews.text: My grand daughter loves it. She thinks it's pretty, warm, and portable. We don't use it for camping. She carries it from room to room to nap and watch tv.
customer_reviews.author: Variscite

customer_reviews.title: Soft, warm, and cozy
customer_reviews.text: Used this sleeping bag in an open tent with overnight temperatures in the low 40s (F). I am a person who is always cold and never goes anywhere without a sweater-- but this sleeping bag kept me perfectly warm and comfortable all night. My only complaint is that getting it back into the included bag is practically impossible. But I'll deal with that, given it keeps my toes (and the rest of me) warm and toasty.
customer_reviews.author: Rae

customer_reviews.title: Awesome zipper, doesn’t bind.
customer_reviews.text: Zipper is excellent, doesn’t bind. Bag is plenty warm. Roomy but the inner material grabs at a t shirt a little bit, it’s more “fabric” than polyester on the inside. I’m 5’11” and 180 lbs, fits very well. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Coleman comes through with a good product at good price point.
customer_reviews.text: This is a dual-purpose product for extra comfort in winter and as a camping bed. I tried it out for a few days and it seems to trap any body heat making me feel really hot indoors (yes its designed for outdoor use i know) I found that removing all my clothes helped me feel more comfortable ( kudos for the comfort factor ) The product exceeds my expectations generally, however static electricity is a problem on windy days.
customer_reviews.author: matthew solorio

customer_reviews.title: ... took these to summer camp and said they were comfortable and just right for a warm summer night
customer_reviews.text: My kids took these to summer camp and said they were comfortable and just right for a warm summer night. I couldn't send them off with their down sleeping bags knowing that the lows were going to be in the 70s. These did the job and the price is right.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Eno

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: My man is a slender 6'5" and he fit in this just fine - I mean he couldn't pull it over his face or anything, but this is a warm weather bag anyway so it worked great pulled up to his shoulders. He is very picky about temperature, and found this warm but breathable.
customer_reviews.author: HN

customer_reviews.title: Great Sleeping Bag
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a camping trip to Catalina, love these sleeping bags, feel great against your skin and keep you warm, in fact there were times when I opened the the whole sleeping bag and just slept with it unzipped. I highly recommend these sleeping bags you will not be disappointed and the price is so good to.
customer_reviews.author: JudyRob

customer_reviews.title: For what it is, and what it costs, can't do much better!
customer_reviews.text: I have much more expensive "mummy" bags for serious camping trips, but they all are very warm, and hence I wake up sweaty (more like drenched) when I use them for summer camping. This is a lower end offering, and isn't for serious backpacking expeditions, but for summer "car camping" trips, you can't beat it for the money. Slept like a baby, kept warm in the cool northern evenings, but wasn't a panting dog when waking up in our sun heated tent. The price makes it a no brainier.
customer_reviews.author: NSBTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Everything we expected it to be. When we camped ...
customer_reviews.text: Everything we expected it to be. When we camped in overnight temps in the high 40s/low 50s, my husband was warm enough, but I was still a little cold. I'm always a little cold so it could just be me--and our tent has "vents" to allow for air flow so that may have made it harder to keep warm as well. But definitely worth the price & will work well for normal summer camping.
customer_reviews.author: teresa shughart

customer_reviews.title: I love the buttons and loops though to assist in re ...
customer_reviews.text: These are warm and cozy yet also let air through when unzipped from the feet. My only complaint is that the tie strings are not that strong. One pulled off the bag in the first day's use. I love the buttons and loops though to assist in re rolling after use. They do NOT fit back in the bags very easily, even with the zipper on the bag fully open, which is to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Annette Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable to both at least 10F above and 10f below its rated range of 40f to 60f
customer_reviews.text: and has held up to over a year of nightly use with zero problems, this has got to be a best value in light duty bags. 10/5/2019 EDIT TO ADD: Still very pleased after all this time, didn't need replacement yet but bought another 'just because' : )
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super warm and cozy
customer_reviews.text: Super warm and cozy. Have not used outdoors but works well indoors, if perhaps a little bit too cozy at times. Soft and fluffy material. After using, roll up and but inside sheath for easy storage. It's definitely more puffy than my last sleeping bag, so is a bit bigger to store away afterwards, but I'm very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Malm

customer_reviews.title: Good bag at 35°
customer_reviews.text: Great bag. I am a scout mom and needless to say, scouts camp regardless of the temp. We had a den campout at the end of April and the morning temp was down to 35°, I was snug and warm in this bag. I did wear underarmour cold gear to sleep in and also sported a boggin. But I was warm. If I had not wore those clothes to sleep in, I would have probably been chilly. And I stay cold, all the time, even in summer sometimes, so if I was warm, the bag is warm.
customer_reviews.author: khodge

customer_reviews.title: Good bag but may end up with a dirty return
customer_reviews.text: Got two of these sleeping bags and were ok. Could not use one at all as the inside looked like someone’s dog slept in it. It was covered in bark and dog hair. Not fun to spend a trip switching between turns sleeping.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Wyman

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but difficult to roll up
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for an 11 year old. Bag itself is ok but it is VERY difficult to roll up correctly. I have trouble doing it as an adult so it's next to impossible for her. Not a big deal for some, but was a problem for us as we need her to be able to do it independently. This product was a miss for is due to this.
customer_reviews.author: shd157

customer_reviews.title: inner material is easily snagged on rough skin or nails
customer_reviews.text: As others have written, inner material is easily snagged on rough skin or nails. Warm enough for most conditions, even around 40 degrees. Zipper works well and is easily long enough for a medium build adult 5'10". Says 5'11" but can see if you're on the "big" side that it would buldge and not be long enough possibly. I did not find it hard to pack back into the outer bag. Just needs some squishing, but wasn't that difficult. You won't be able to get into outer bag and zip up, but it gets in.
customer_reviews.author: M. Chen

customer_reviews.title: Very Cozy Sleeping Bag
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use indoors on top of a Coleman air mattress that i take to visit family. I am always cold sleeping on the mattress no matter how many blankets i put between the mattress and me. The mattress is so comfortable that I wanted it to work. This bag eliminated the problem. I warmed up very quickly in this bag and stayed toasty all night. I looked forward to getting in it the second night.
customer_reviews.author: amyg

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't purchase again, but I will use this one.
customer_reviews.text: The interior material is unpleasant. It reminds me of those cheap stuffed animals you get at the fair booths. Re-stuffing it into the shell is challenging, but the tabs that hold it folded do help. Size was as expected and I really like the snag-free zipper.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Good for outdoor summer camping
customer_reviews.text: The sleeping bag looks good and it good value for money. I bought it for my child to use in summer camp. He enjoyed it and had no complaints. It washes well and dries pretty quickly.
customer_reviews.author: L. Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: The zipper does not work. The ties do not wrap up the sleeping bag tight enough. I roll it up and stuff it in the bag without using the ties, and that works ok. The zipper jammed immediately so we cannot use it. It is written as warm weather, but it is a little too hot in the warm weather. All in all, I am not satisfied at all with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Big Online Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Was happy with these for the price! Comfy and warm, my daughter did get bugged by the way her feet kind of scratched on the inside material, but she just used a light blanket inside and that solved that.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, Soft & Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Good value for what you get. Lightweight, easy to pack, and kept me warm on camping trip that was in the 50’s and drizzling. Soft and comfortable. Recommend for casual camping.
customer_reviews.author: Catdiva77

customer_reviews.title: Damaged zipper
customer_reviews.text: 1 if 2 sleeping bags ordered had the fabric pulling away from the zipper. Coleman's inspection doesn't seem very good. We ordered 4 different Coleman products and each shipment had damage. It's inconvenient to have to ship back.
customer_reviews.author: S. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Roomy and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used a sleeping bag since my days in the Military decades ago. Wow have they changed! lol Very comfortable and easily rolls back up to fit into carrying bag instead of trying to force it in. Strongly recommend for the occasional camper.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Young

customer_reviews.title: soft, warm
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the Coleman Adult Sleeping Bag for my husband who stayed warm, dry, and comfortable on a recent camping trip when temperatures were in the low 40’s – will be retiring my mummy bag and buying another of these for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Lcb

customer_reviews.title: pretty much what everyone else said about it
customer_reviews.text: pretty much what everyone else said about it,esp. if you have rough skin that catches on the material,however that wasn't much of a problem for me. I have a down bag and an old coleman that I bought at the cannery for half price thats good to 5degrees,so was looking for a light bag and esp. for the price, it was great!!
customer_reviews.author: g b

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for intended use. Bought for my 8 year old daughter for scout camping and family camping. THis is something that she can keep for a whilw a grow into (so I do not have to keep buying new themed sleeping bags) Soft and warm enought for 50 degree weather. The fabric inside is like most sleeping bags not as soft as your favorite blankee but it will do)
customer_reviews.author: Kari

customer_reviews.title: Overall, a reasonable sleeping bag. I will say ...
customer_reviews.text: Overall, a reasonable sleeping bag. I will say that I got a little too warm sleeping in this indoors. I also am not overly fond of the material used for the lining of this sleeping bag. As others have stated in their reviews, it tends to "catch" on your skin... This wasn't a huge drawback for me, as I was fully clothed & wearing socks, but I could definitely see how it would get irritating.
customer_reviews.author: H. L. Kern

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping bag for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sleeping bag for my daughter who is 11 years old and goes on many sleepovers with friends. She needed a warmer and longer sleeping bag than the sleeping bags offered for little kids. This works great for her, keeps her warm and will be great if she ever goes camping. It is easy to roll up and store; although it is a little challenging for her to do it. The coloring in the picture shoes a very light grey interior; I would say it is a bit darker grey than the picture shows, other than that it is a great sleeping bag for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Lori Trovato

customer_reviews.title: Soft and great minor detail for rough hands
customer_reviews.text: Very soft, the inside fibres are synthetic so if you have small burs on your working hands(you know if you know) you will feel your hands getting slightly caught. You get used to it and appreciate it's softness though.
customer_reviews.author: Robertl

customer_reviews.title: They are warm and have a nice thickness. Easy to roll back up and get ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for camping out in the yard with the grandkids and weekend trips in the fall to the island and some lighthouse scenery. Have only used them in the back yard. They are warm and have a nice thickness. Easy to roll back up and get into their bags. I will update when we check them out thru the fall. I'm comfortable recommending them now as far as summer and early fall.
customer_reviews.author: Lynnette Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the sleeping bag from the Amazon Warehouse, knowing it wouldn't be k. Brand new condition, but expecting for it to have all of its parts! The bag that contains the sleeping bag was missing a zipper and a string fixture. It was very obviously not in good condition. This error falls on the shoulders of whoever inspected it and deemed it sellable, not on the manufacture of the produce itself. Unacceptable, for my husband's birthday present :(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good bag overall
customer_reviews.text: The sleeping bag was great for tent camping in warm weather. The zipper wasn't super smooth but at this price point good bag.
customer_reviews.author: Gary R.

customer_reviews.title: Useful in extremes of weather!
customer_reviews.text: Thank god to have purchased this way before our trip to Yellowstone hiking and camping. I am alive this day coz it let me tolerate the harsh chill. Also, its good for indoors in case you have guest, you would love yourself to be slept in the cozy and warm Sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: anshul

customer_reviews.title: Good warm weather bag
customer_reviews.text: This is our second of the same bag. We use it for tent camping. It was a cool night that started out in the seventies and dropped as we slept. Very comfortable bag. I'm not sure why others complain about the lining, I like it. It's rather soft. I guess you could get caught on it, but I've had no problems. Good warm weather bag.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The 2 packing cords are wrongly located.
customer_reviews.text: The sleeping bag is fine until you try to put it back in the hold-all. The 2 packing/rolling cords are wrongly located and we would like an exchange for a sleeping bag with properly located cords.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Summer Sleeping Bag
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son for summer overnight camp. Great quality , comfortable, warm enough, easy to clean. Much better price than the big outdoor companies.
customer_reviews.author: Kiwi

customer_reviews.title: A warm winters night!
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag is as warm as I would need any bag. It was in the 20’s and I was literally sweating with my flannels. Definitely think this bag is a great buy. Mine washed out just fine and dried nicely too. Even 2 of my cats found room to snuggle.
customer_reviews.author: Helene  "Laney"

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not great
customer_reviews.text: The kids love sleeping in them, and they seem to be well built, but... 1. You have to roll it up, rather than use a stuff sack. 2. It uses those stupid cords to tie it up rather than elastic straps. 3. The carry bag should be just a touch bigger so that it does not take 2 people to get it back in each time.
customer_reviews.author: CoachDad

customer_reviews.title: Multi-purpose Sleeping Bag & Very pet friendly!!
customer_reviews.text: Went camping and needed any extra sleeping bag. Glad we purchased this because our air mattress deflated in the middle of the night so we used this to pad the ground as well as keep us warm. Good material and great price. Side note: Keep away from you pet, ours loves to try and crawl inside an stick her head out. Super cute but she keeps unraveling the sleeping bag!
customer_reviews.author: mattyjenks21

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping bag!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great sleeping bag! We used it recently when camping and it got down to about 50 degrees F at night and we were very comfortable. It rolls up nice and compact and comes with a bag to store it in. We bought 2 so they can be zipped together when we camp.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Ritzema

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Super comfy and warm! Easy to open & close, the zipper never got stuck once. I’ll definitely be buying another one.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Very good buy
customer_reviews.text: Overall a good bag for minimal needs. Easy to roll up and store in the carry bag, and it is comfy to sleep in. Vibrant color if that matters. 100% worth the price
customer_reviews.author: James Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Warm and comfy!
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag had kept me warm many a freezing night. I use this on the ship instead of a comforter. I think it's easier to make up the bed with it. My ship, for some reason, keeps the A/C on 40 all the time. It gets cold when you're not on flight deck. My only qualm is the swishy outside fabric. I always feel like it's really loud when everyone is sleeping and I have to roll over and adjust. Next time I'll buy the one with soft fabric inside and out.
customer_reviews.author: Sterling

customer_reviews.title: Efficient Use
customer_reviews.text: Too large and too difficult to fit in the case. It is efficient in terms of use, but it is not easy to carry around.
customer_reviews.author: martha

customer_reviews.title: For the price, no complaints.
customer_reviews.text: This is a 20 dollar buy! Can't complain about anything really. The polyester filling isn't as uncomfortable as other reviews make it out to be. It's definitely comfortable enough to sleep soundly in. I mean, after all, how comfortable do you expect to be when you're out camping anyway? No sleeping bag is going to be a queen size mattress in terms of comfort. If you're on a budget and have spent more than 20 minutes thinking about it already, just buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: ViduraAmazon Customer

product_meta.title: Coleman Sun Ridge 40°F Warm Weather Sleeping Bag, Blue
product_meta.description:
The Coleman Sun Ridge 40°F Warm Weather Sleeping Bag measures 33 x 75 inches and fits most campers up to 5 feet 11 inches tall. It's durably constructed of a polyester cover with a soft tricot liner, while 3 pounds of ThermoTech insulation allow you to sleep comfortably in temperatures between 40°F and 60°F. The ZipPlow zipper pushes fabric away from teeth for snag-free zipping and unzipping. The ComfortCuff fabric trim along the opening surrounds your face with softness. Fiberlock construction prevents insulation from shifting to keep you warm and increase durability, while the Thermolock draft tube along the length of the zipper prevents heat loss. Roll Control fasteners lock the bag in place for easier rolling when it's time to pack up, and the QuickCord no-tie closure keeps everything cinched tight. Machine washable for easy cleaning at home.

AMAZON.COM
Stay cozy on warmer nights with the Coleman Trinidad sleeping bag. Designed for temperatures between 40 and 60 degrees F, the Trinidad is perfect for the summer months when the mercury seldom dips below freezing. The Trinidad is durably constructed of a polyester cover with a soft tricot fiber-blend liner, with 3 pounds of ThermoTech insulation to keep you comfy. The bag is also outfitted with Coleman's ComfortSmart technology, which includes such features as a ComfortCuff that surrounds your face with softness, a FiberLock design that prevents the insulation from shifting, and a QuickCord for easy, no-tie closure. 

 To keep heat from escaping on cooler nights, the Trinidad includes a ThermoLock construction that prevents heat loss through the zipper. Other features include a Roll Control that locks the bag in place for easier rolling, ZipperGlide tailoring that allows smooth zipper operation around the corners, and a rectangular build that measures 33 by 75 inches. The bag is machine-washable in commercial machines and carries a five-year warranty.
feature_bullets: For camping in temperatures between 40°F and 60°F. The warm weather bag fits heights up to 5 feet 11 inch
Polyester cover with soft tricot fiber blend liner
ComfortCuff surrounds your face with softness
Roll Control fasteners lock bag in place for easier rolling
Fiberlock prevents insulation from shifting, increasing durability
Thermolock draft tube reduces heat loss through the zipper, keeping you warmer
ZipperGlide tailoring allows smooth zipper operation around corners
QuickCord no-tie closure keeps bag cinched tight

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
